title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1 CRC LEGISLATIONS & POLICIES

description.narrative: Output 2.1 (CRC based legislations & policies): By 2020, the social sector institutions will have effective tools and mechanisms with which to coordinate and evaluate the comprehensive protection system, including violence prevention and reduction, the prevention of institutionalization, and the protection of children in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 (Comprehensive Protection): By 2020, children and adolescents will have a comprehensive system for protecting their rights plus comprehensive protection and violence reduction policies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1 (CRC based legislations & policies): By 2020, the social sector institutions will have effective tools and mechanismswith which to coordinate and evaluate the comprehensive protection system, including violence prevention and reduction, theprevention of institutionalization, and the protection of children in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: As result of UNICEF’s advocacy and technical assistance, the Panamanian Government approved a new legislation on the comprehensive protection of first infancy and early childhood development. The new normative framework is aligned with the Convention of the Rights of Children and follows the 2018 recommendations by the Geneva Committee of Rights of Children. PCO is also providing technical assistance to the government to accompany the elaboration of sublegal regulations and procedures and implementation. With support from PCO, SENNIAF strengthened the attention to children without parental care during the pandemic, thus progressing the deinstitutionalization policy. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/01/2021
